resources.string: Enter your Babybuddy Server URL, username, and password. The press login to connect the Babybuddy App to the Babybuddy Server.
If you use a http-address instead of a https-address,…
… the application will show you this warning. Only use this feature for local BabyBuddy servers in a network that you control!
After you logged in, the first thing you should do is setup the timers. Depending how you use babybuddy, there might be some timers already preconfigured when using the app for the first time or not…
If no timers are defined yet, you can click on the "Create Default Timers" button to create a set of default timers for the primary baby buddy activities you might want to log.
If timers are already defined, you can create the same set of timers by selecting the "Recreate Default Timers" option from the menu
Alternatively, you can configure the activity for pre-existing timers to match reuse them directly.
After logging in, the application will show a full-screen overview for a given child. If you have multiple children, you can swipe horizontally to change the view to another child.
The upper part of the application shows buttons for logging activities for the current child. The lower part lists logged events for that child in reverse chronological order.
The top controls allow logging of diaper changes. Click the wet or solid button to check the type, then…
… optionally, add a notes-text and finally press the save button to save the diaper change.
Press the "play"-button to start a timer for any of the listed activity types.
While the timer is running you can add notes as usual.
When the timer should be logged, you press the save button to store the activity.
Feeding timers will show a special form after storing. The feeding type and feeding method need to be entered before a feeding can be stored.

The lower portion of the application shows a list of the most recent logged activities of a given child. You can delete individual entries by pressing the red delete button next to the actvity. In addition, you can long-press an entry to open the corresponding page for the logged activity in the BabyBuddy app directly.
